alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 1:55PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF APACHE COUNTY EAST OF PETRIFIED FOREST NATIONAL PARK THROUGH 230 PM MST... At 154 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Petrified Forest National Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Petrified Forest National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
